Key Arguments: The proposed legislation infringes on the constitutional right to free speech.
The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are politicized and misused to suppress legitimate opinions.
The ACMA should not be given more power as it would violate the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR).
Historical examples show the dangers of suppressing free speech, such as during Nazi Germany.
Personal anecdotes suggest negative consequences of labeling certain information as misinformation, particularly regarding COVID-19 vaccines.
Notable Quotes: The job of MP's & Senators by Oath of Office is to DEFEND our Constitutional Right to FREE SPEECH.
The ACMA has a Constitutional Duty to UPHOLD FREE SPEECH online!
Giving the ACMA more power would violate the UDHR (1948) - thus the ACMA will be guilty of violating the Human Rights of all Australian citizens!
